hive.model.roadnetwork package¶

Submodules¶

hive.model.roadnetwork.haversine_roadnetwork module¶

class hive.model.roadnetwork.haversine_roadnetwork.HaversineRoadNetwork[source]¶

Bases: hive.model.roadnetwork.roadnetwork.RoadNetwork

Implements a simple haversine road network where a unique node exists for each unique GeoId in the simulation. This assumes a fully connected graph between each node in which the shortest path is the link that connects any two nodes. LinkId is specified as a concatenation of the GeoId of its endpoints in which the order is given by origin and destination respectively.

sim_h3_resolution = 15¶

hive.model.roadnetwork.link module¶

class hive.model.roadnetwork.link.Link[source]¶

Bases: tuple

a directed edge on the road network from node a -> node b the LinkId is used for lookup of link attributes the o/d pair of GeoIds is the start and end locations along this link. in the case of the RoadNetwork, these are (strictly) members of the vertex set. an agent route may also use a Link to represent a partial link traversal, using an o/d pair which is within the link but not necessarily the end-points.

link_id¶
start¶
end¶
hive.model.roadnetwork.link.interpolate_between_geoids(a, b, ratio)[source]¶
Return type

str

hive.model.roadnetwork.link.link_distance(link)[source]¶

determines the distance of a link :type link: Link :param link: some road network link, possibly with a different start/end point from the matching link in the road network :rtype: Unit :return: the distance of this link, in kilometers

hive.model.roadnetwork.linktraversal module¶

class hive.model.roadnetwork.linktraversal.LinkTraversal[source]¶

Bases: tuple

represents the traversal of a link. traversed_link represents any part of the link that was traversed. remaining_link represents any part of the link that remains to be traversed remaining_time represents any time the agent has left to traverse additional links

traversed¶
remaining¶
remaining_time¶
hive.model.roadnetwork.linktraversal.traverse_up_to(road_network, property_link, available_time)[source]¶

using the ground truth road network, and some agent Link traversal, attempt to traverse the link, based on travel time calculations from the Link’s PropertyLink attributes. :type road_network: RoadNetwork :param road_network: the road network :type property_link: PropertyLink :param property_link: the plan the agent has to traverse a subset of a road network link :type available_time: Unit :param available_time: the remaining time the agent has in this time step :rtype: Union[Exception, LinkTraversal] :return: the updated traversal, or, an exception.

on update, if there is any remaining traversal, return an updated Link. if no traversal remains, return None. regardless, return the agent’s remaining time after traversing if there was any error, return the exception instead.

hive.model.roadnetwork.routetraversal module¶

Bases: tuple

no_time_left()[source]¶

if we have no more time, then end the traversal :return: True if the agent is out of time

add_traversal(t)[source]¶

take the result of a link traversal and update the route traversal :type t: LinkTraversal :param t: a link traversal :rtype: RouteTraversal :return: the updated route traversal

add_link_not_traversed(link)[source]¶

if a link wasn’t traversed, be sure to add it to the remaining route :type link: PropertyLink :param link: a link for the remaining route :rtype: RouteTraversal :return: the updated RouteTraversal

hive.model.roadnetwork.routetraversal.traverse(route_estimate, road_network, time_step)[source]¶

step through the route from the current agent position (assumed to be start.link_id) toward the destination :type route_estimate: Tuple[PropertyLink, …] :param route_estimate: the current route estimate :type road_network: RoadNetwork :param road_network: the current road network state :type time_step: Unit :param time_step: size of the time step for this traversal :rtype: Union[Exception, RouteTraversal, None] :return: a route experience and updated route estimate;

or, nothing if the route is consumed. an exception is possible if the current step is not found on the link or the route is malformed.
